rooms.description: A spacious north-facing entrance with a vestibule designed for natural light and ventilation.
Central living area focusing on natural light with large windows to the east for morning sun, ensuring comfort and energy flow.
Adjacent to living room, designed to maximize cross ventilation and natural light with south-facing windows.
Functional kitchen layout with ample natural lighting from the west. Incorporates Brutalist design elements such as raw concrete finishes.
Spacious master bedroom with north-east facing windows to harness positive energy and natural light, ensuring restful ambiance.
Comfortable child bedroom with south-west orientation for balanced energy flow.
Second child's bedroom designed in a north-west direction to promote calm and concentration.
Dedicated home office with south-facing windows optimizing natural light. Incorporates a minimalist design using concrete finishes typical of Brutalist architecture.
Well-ventilated bathroom designed with privacy and energy flow in mind, featuring north-west windows for balanced lighting.

openings.description: North-facing main entrance door to allow positive energy flow and natural light.
Large east-facing window to harness morning sunlight and improve natural ventilation.
South-facing window to balance interior temperature and provide ample natural light.
West-facing window to capture the evening light and enhance ventilation.
